properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Is Being Issued For The Village Of Loreburn.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Loreburn. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Village of Loreburn water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2019-06-28T09:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Loreburn, 2019-06-24T15:00:53-06:00, F61CB436-87EB-CA4A-5F4B-F59561F0A92B
Area: Village of Loreburn
properties.Author: SK Loreburn

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, will continue through the afternoon before tapering to scattered showers later tonight. Total rainfall amounts of 30 to 40 mm are possible. This rainfall may lead to localized flooding in low-lying areas and water pooling on roads. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-25T23:16:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T15:17:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1452670196.2019
Area: Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:13 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is over the Sandilands Provincial Forest and is moving slowly eastward. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-25T21:12:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T18:14:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3889201123.2019
Area: R.M. of Reynolds incl. Ste. Rita Hadashville and Rennie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement Ended
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is no longer expected or has moved out of the area. ###
Expires: 2019-06-25T19:06:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-25T18:06:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3846421266.2019
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La Crête and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog is coming in off of Lake Superior. Fog will persist today and for much of tonight before finally dissipating Wednesday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-26T09:30:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T17:31:14-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2446698786.2019
Area: Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-06-26T10:24:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T18:24:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2249466150.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Buchans and the interior, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and persist into the evening before dissipating. Main threats with these thunderstorms are expected to be hail and heavy downpours. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-26T04:24:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-25T16:25:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0763372009.2019
Area: Ft. Liard Region including Nahanni Butte - Sambaa K'e, Ft. Simpson Region including Jean Marie River, Ft. Providence Region including Kakisa - Chan Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: Areas of Mackenzie County remain under threat due to wildfire and there is the potential for evacuation. ### More information is available at the Mackenzie County website https://www.mackenziecounty.com/sole-state-of-local-emergency and https://www.facebook.com/Mackenzie-County-262409787134568/ Facebook page. Additional wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Go to www.511.alberta.ca for updated road report information.
Expires: 2019-07-02T11:24:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of Mackenzie County, 2019-06-25T11:22:17-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5877
Area: Mackenzie #23
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on Behalf of Mackenzie County
